特記事項: 【合併】International Economic Integration（国際学研究科前期）/International Economic Integration（経営戦略研究科）
授業の概要・背景: This course consists of five sections. 1) Introduction; 2) basic trade theories; 3) trade policy; 4) trade and economic development; and 5) current trade topics. Each session will include lectures on theory, empirical issues, and analytical tools and data.  In addition, students learn how to apply theory and empirical research to international trade policies through discussions and presentations in group works.
授業方法: Face to face class format.Lectures (60%) , Hands on exercises (30%) & Presentation (10%)

第1回: Introduction: overview of world trade & global economy
第2回: Introduction to trade theory: comparative advantage, trade patterns and benefit of trade
第3回: International trade theory 1: Classical trade model (the Ricardian Model)
第4回: International trade theory 2: Framework for Neo-classical model
第5回: International trade theory 3: Neo-classical Model  (the Specifica Factor Model)
第6回: International trade theory 4: Neo-classical Model  (the Heckscher-Ohlin Model)
第7回: International trade theory 5: New Trade Theory (Economies of scale and location of production)
第8回: International trade theory 6: New-new Trade Theory (Firms in the global economy)
第9回: Multinational enterpirses and Foregin Direct Investment
第12回: Research papers and reports to be distributed in advance
第13回: United Nations, Trade and Development Report; etc.
第14回: Digital service trade and current issues in international trade
United Nations, Trade and Development Report; etc.
